channel.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
channel.description:
just a heads up, that Im doing some testing with El Capitan (10.11) , it does appear some things might have changed (e.g. it looks like java is not installed by default anymore), I will update the install guide for OSX, once I've determine any changes required.
please post here if you notice any issue particular to 10.11 do NOT report any issues here which exist (or may exist) in other versions of OS X.
current install guide: http://community.axoloti.com/t/installing-on-mac-os-x/37

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @orbitbot Patrik Johnson
item.description:
@orbitbot wrote:

This might well not be the correct place for this, but as of a few hours ago, Axoloti 1.0.11 is available on Homebrew. If you have it installed on your Mac, Axoloti is available with

brew install Caskroom/cask/axoloti

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @workerparasite303
item.description:
@workerparasite303 wrote:

thetechnobear:

are either of you using a retina display?

not using retina, no issues so far

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @paul
item.description:
@paul wrote:

@thetechnobear
Ok, I tried to check some Patcher position on my screen. I haven't any UI issues with axoloti (1.0.7), MB 15" retina and 10.11.

But If my cursor is near at screen edge and I open the object window, it will be out of the screen dimension â€¦but this is since the first editor version.

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

@paul @workerparasite303
do either of you have any UI issues when dragging wires if the patcher is NOT in the top left of the screen?

are either of you using a retina display?

I have an issue, but I'm not sure if its retina vs non-retina or 10.10 vs 10.11

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @paul
item.description:
@paul wrote:

after reinstalling everything works fine now. I thought, it happened because I had a bigger version jump about 2 or 3 versions releases.

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @workerparasite303
item.description:
@workerparasite303 wrote:

just installed this on 10.11.2 and had no issues

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

If anyone sees this again,
can you please attempt to run Axoloti from the 'terminal'... and see if any errors are shown in the terminal window.

Ive made a change that will be release soon, that hopefully will mean instead of the app kind of not starting (by which I think most mean the console window doesnt open, and menus are not present) , the console should appear, and so errors may show up there.... hopefully then we can track it down.
the current working assumption is, that its caused by a 'corrupt' preferences file. but with no detailed reports its hard to say for sure.

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @paul
item.description:
@paul wrote:

I had the same error. I get it working by deleting axoloti app and the axoloti library files. I used the Appcleaner app.
After deleting everything, I reinstall everything and it works fine.

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @Acsii Nez Pender
item.description:
@Acsii wrote:

For some reason the runtime seems to be loading. The app opens but then nothing else happens.

Read full topic

item.title: El Capitan - Mac OSX 10.11
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

just a heads up, that Im doing some testing with El Capitan (10.11) , it does appear some things might have changed (e.g. it looks like java is not installed by default anymore), I will update the install guide for OSX, once I've determine any changes required.

please post here if you notice any issue particular to 10.11
do NOT report any issues here which exist (or may exist) in other versions of OS X.

current install guide:

Installing on Mac OS X User Guide
Normal Installation To reduce size we split the application into two parts, the main axoloti application, and a runtime which contains other required files. You must download and install both initially. (Usually updates will only require the main application to be downloaded and installed.) download both application bundle and axoloti_runtime go to http://github.com/axoloti/axoloti/releases, you will see the 'latest release' download axo_runtime_osx_(version).dmg download axoloti_osx_(versâ€¦

Read full topic
